suncertify.client

Class ClientController

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.client.ClientController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalClientController, RemoteClientController

    public abstract class ClientController
extends java.lang.Object
    The ClientController is the abstract base class for all the controllers in the the Contractor Broker application. It also serves as a parameterized factory for the creation of ClientController types.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    getController(AppRunMode), LocalClientController, RemoteClientController

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int controllerId
      This is an integer denoting the unique ID assigned to this controller when it registered with the DB Server for DB updates.
      protected BrokerServerIF databaseServer
      This is a reference to a BrokerServerIF object.
      private java.util.logging.Logger logger
      This is a reference to a Logger object.
      private static java.lang.String REMOTE_SERVER_ERROR_MSG
      A String object denoting the text displayed when the controller encounters an error when calls are made to the server.

    • Method Detail

      • getController

        public static ClientController getController(AppRunMode mode)
                                      throws BrokerClientException,
                                             BrokerServerException
        This method provides the mechanism for the creation of Controller objects. The type of object created depends on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        mode - This is the application run mode
        Returns:
        A reference to a ClientController object type depending on the input parameter.
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - If the wrong mode was specified.
        BrokerServerException - If the controller being requested had issues communicating with the server.
        See Also:
        AppRunMode, LocalClientController, RemoteClientController

      • addRecord

        public int addRecord(ContractorRecord record)
              throws DuplicateKeyException,
                     BrokerServerException
        This method adds a new record to the database on behalf of the client associated with this controller.
        Parameters:
        record - A reference to the ContractorRecord object to be added to the database.
        Returns:
        An integer value uniquely identifying the added record. The value may be the record number of a previously deleted record that matches the new record being added.
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - if the Name and Location attributes of the record match that of an existing record in the database.
        BrokerServerException - if there are errors encountered in the add process.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.addRecord(ContractorRecord)

      • getRecord

        public ContractorRecord getRecord(int recNo)
                           throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                  BrokerServerException
        This method returns an array of String objects denoting the attributes of the record uniquely identified by the integer record number in the parameter. The call is relayed to the DB server.
        Parameters:
        recNo - - An integer value denoting the unique identifier of the record to be fetched from the database.
        Returns:
        A reference to a ContractorBroker object denoting the requested record.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record number does not match any record in the database or if a matching record was found but had been deleted.
        BrokerServerException - If there were problems communicating with the DB server.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.getRecord(int)

      • deleteRecord

        public void deleteRecord(ContractorRecord record)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         InvalidRecordStateException,
                         BrokerServerException
        This method relays the call to delete from the database the record uniquely identified by the integer value parameter value. This is accomplished by forwarding the call to the database server.
        Parameters:
        record - - A reference to the ContractorRecord object to be deleted.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record number does not match any record in the database or if a matching record was found but had been deleted.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If the attributes of the record had changed since it was fetched from the database.
        BrokerServerException - If there was a problem communicating with the server.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.deleteRecord(ContractorRecord)

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(ContractorRecord oldVal,
                         ContractorRecord newVal)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         InvalidRecordStateException,
                         BrokerServerException
        This method forwards requests to update a record to the DB server.
        Parameters:
        oldVal - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the state of the record before the update.
        newVal - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the state of the record after the update.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - - If the recNo does not match any record in the database or the matching record had been deleted.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If the attributes of the record had changed since it was fetched from the database.
        BrokerServerException - - If there was a problem communicating with the server.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.updateRecord(ContractorRecord,ContractorRecord)

      • bookRecord

        public void bookRecord(ContractorRecord record)
                throws RecordNotFoundException,
                       InvalidRecordStateException,
                       BrokerServerException
        This method forwards a record booking request to the database server.
        Parameters:
        record - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the record to be booked.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record number does not match any record in the database or if a matching record was found but had been deleted.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If attributes of the record had changed since it was read from the database.
        BrokerServerException - If there were problems communicating with the DB server.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.bookRecord(ContractorRecord)

      • releaseRecord

        public void releaseRecord(ContractorRecord record)
                   throws RecordNotFoundException,
                          InvalidRecordStateException,
                          BrokerServerException
        This method forwards a record release request to the database server.
        Parameters:
        record - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the record to be released.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record number does not match any record in the database or if a matching record was found but had been deleted.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If attributes of the record had changed since it was read from the database.
        BrokerServerException - If there were problems communicating with the DB server.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.releaseRecord(ContractorRecord)

      • findRecords

        public ContractorRecord[] findRecords(ContractorRecord criteria)
                               throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                      BrokerServerException
        This method forwards record search request to the database server.
        Parameters:
        criteria - A reference to a ContractorRecord object. The attributes of the object denote the search criterion for the corresponding attribute for each record in the database.
        Returns:
        An array of ContractorRecord objects denoting the records that match the specified criteria.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If not record matching the specified criteria was found.
        BrokerServerException - If there were problems communicating with the database server.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.findRecords(ContractorRecord)

      • notifyUpdate

        public void notifyUpdate()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This is the callback for nofification of DB updates.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If a communication problem is encountered in calls to this method.

      • stopController

        public void stopController()
                    throws BrokerClientException
        The call to this method will result in the controller unregistering itself for DB updates from the DB server.
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - If there was a problem communicating with the server.
